content.description:
Consider the following statement, which is intended to generate an integer between  1  and  10,  inclusive, and assign it to  result.  This statement does not work as intended.
 int result = (int) Math.random() * 10 + 1;
content.question: Which of the following changes can be made so that this statement works as intended?

choices.label: Add parentheses around the expression 10 + 1, as shown in the following statement. int result = (int) Math.random() * (10 + 1);
Add parentheses around the expression Math.random() * 10, as shown in the following statement.int result = (int) (Math.random() * 10) + 1;
Change the value of 10 to 9, as shown in the following statement.int result = (int) Math.random() * 9 + 1;
Remove the cast of Math.random() to an int value, as shown in the following statement.int result = Math.random() * 10 + 1;

content.answer: Add parentheses around the expression Math.random() * 10, as shown in the following statement.int result = (int) (Math.random() * 10) + 1;

skill.text: 3.D: Explain why a code segment will not compile or work as intended and modify the code to correct the error.
